    • Constructor Detail

      • JugPuzzle

        public JugPuzzle()
        Constructor for the JugPuzzle.

    • Method Detail

      • getMoves

        public int getMoves()
        Gets the number of moves (spills) done so far. Useful for the end of the game when you want to know how many steps the user took to solve the puzzle.
        Returns:
        - int: Number of moves so far.

      • getIsPuzzleSolved

        public boolean getIsPuzzleSolved()
        Determines whether the puzzle is solved. This occurs when the first 2 jugs each have a water level of 4 and the third jug is empty.
        Returns:
        boolean: Whether it's solved or not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of the jugPuzzle. Used in the game so the user can see the current status of all the jugs and the number of moves taken so far.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • spill

        public void spill(Jug spillFrom,
                  Jug spillTo)
        A helper function for move. All the transfer of water between jugs is done by this function.
        Parameters:
        spillFrom - - Jug: The jug being spilled.
        spillTo - - Jug: The jug having water poured into it.

      • move

        public void move(int from,
                 int to)
        The move class. This function is called during the jugPuzzle game every time the user specifies two jugs for water transfer. From the integers supplied, this function assigns the corresponding jugs and runs the spill function on them.
        Parameters:
        from - The jug number of the jug to be spilled
        to - The jug number of the jug to add water to
